node.title: Police deny media spotlight led to man being allowed into WA to see sick mum
node.alt: A man in a red jacket wears a mask while pictured seated in an airport lounge
node.description: A man who made it through WA's hard border to see his sick mother commends the WA Government for wanting to keep people safe, but says he's shocked at the process he had to go through to make it home to Perth.
node.content:
["A man who made a public appeal to be allowed into WA to see his sick mother has arrived in Perth.", "Ethan Carter, who flew\u00a0to Sydney from Los Angeles yesterday, told a large media contingent at the airport\u00a0his mother was close to death.\u00a0", "Mr Carter was allowed to enter WA after the State Emergency Coordinator, Police Commissioner Chris Dawson, personally signed the authorisation.", "Soon after landing in Perth\u00a0he said he didn't expect to be able to get to WA so quickly.", "", "
'Mark, think of the people who are suffering': Man's plea to enter WA to see sick mother
", "\"It's good to be home (in)\u00a0my home state, for sure,\" he said.", "\"A big shock, I wasn't expecting this at all.", "\"I spent a lot of time, I guess, calling around and speaking to a lot of departments.", "\"Once I got a hold of a few very helpful individuals at Service New South Wales and the Health Department of New South Wales, they were really sort of rallying for me.", "\"I just want to see my mum and I have to wait a bit longer, the family's very sensitive, we've just got to be private now and just focus on seeing mum.\"", "
Man 'shocked' at the process to get into WA
", "Mr Carter said he would not be able to see his mother for some time as would have to\u00a0do two weeks of quarantine in a hotel.", "He was shocked at the processes he had to go through in order to leave the USA and enter Australia and WA.", "\"I've been living in the United States for a while and they're in a very different process right now.", "\"It's a very different economy and very different government and that sort of thing so it's really quite shocking to go through this level of procedure.", "\"I'd say there's no-one else in the western world that's doing it to this degree.", "\"Certainly I commend that.\"\u00a0", "
Police deny media spotlight accelerated\u00a0approval
", "Acting Police Commissioner Col Blanch\u00a0told ABC Radio in Perth Mr Carter's\u00a0authorisation occurred after more information was submitted via G2G Pass processes.", "\"The most important thing for any person is to have very clear medical advice, medical evidence from a doctor about what those circumstances are,\" he said.", "\"Once that was provided to us, he was allowed in.", "\"Certainly the advice provided by a medical professional allowed us to make the right decision for him because we could verify what he was saying.\"", "", "
Acting Police Commissioner Col Blanch says the man's entry was approved after he submitted medical evidence.(ABC News: Herlyn Kaur)
", "The Acting Commissioner said the decision wasn't made because of his media appearance.", "\"Lots of people tell lots of stories about why they want to come into Western Australia, it's not that we don't believe them, we just ask for evidence to prove what they're saying is actually true.", "\"And we would never overrule a doctor's or a medical professional's reason for why that person needs to come in.", "\"Now, it's not about him getting on the radio or to get on to see the Premier, this is actually about\u00a0the evidence that he put forward, later on, did that meet the test, and it did.\"", "Mr Carter will be subject to COVID-19 testing while doing his 14 days hotel quarantine.", "WA Police said any \"visitation to his mother will be closely managed in line with public health advice and practices\".", "", "
While Australia has thrown open its international borders, many barriers to overseas travel remain for WA residents.\u00a0(ABC News: Herlyn Kaur)
", "There have been happy family reunions in the eastern states this week as Australia finally opened up for international travel, but many barriers remain in WA.\u00a0", "In New South Wales, Victoria or the ACT citizens are able to plan family reunions and holidays abroad without facing a mandatory and expensive 14-days in hotel quarantine on their return.", "Similarly, in Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania or the Northern Territory\u00a0governments have flagged\u00a0to scrap hotel quarantine requirements over the coming weeks as vaccination rates lift.", "But there are no detailed plans for Western Australia yet.", "Mark McGowan plans to double the international arrivals cap once the state hits the 70 per cent vaccination threshold, but the travel industry said\u00a0that was\u00a0not enough as it only equated\u00a0to two plane loads of people a week.\u00a0"]
